abstract: A management reshuffling would make James Press, the director of North American operations, the highest ranking non-Japanese in the company’s history.
snippet: A management reshuffling would make James Press, the director of North American operations, the highest ranking non-Japanese in the company’s history.
lead_paragraph: TOKYO, April 12 — Toyota announced a management shuffle on Thursday that would elevate the president of its North American operations, James E. Press, to be the first non-Japanese to sit on the automaker’s board.

headline.main: Toyota Promotes an American to Its Board
headline.print_headline: Increasing Board Size, Toyota Names First American Director
